DataElement.preferredName: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index Q5C Past Month Have Trouble Sleeping Because Have to Get Up to Use the Bathroom Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated perception of how often in the past month they have had trouble sleeping because they have to get up to use the bathroom, using a 4 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index Past Month Trouble Sleeping, Get Up to Use the Bathroom Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A self-rated questionnaire which assesses sleep quality and disturbances over a one month time interval._Before the present time._One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks._A question about an individual's trouble sleeping because of getting up to use the bathroom._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A self-rated questionnaire which assesses sleep quality and disturbances over a one month time interval.

Concepts.definition: A self-rated questionnaire which assesses sleep quality and disturbances over a one month time interval.

Property.preferredName: Past Month Trouble Sleeping, Get Up to Use the Bathroom Score
Property.preferredDefinition: Before the present time.:One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.:A question about an individual's trouble sleeping because of getting up to use the bathroom.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.

Concepts.longName: Trouble Sleeping, Get Up to Use the Bathroom
Concepts.definition: A question about an individual's trouble sleeping because of getting up to use the bathroom.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: PSQI Frequency Score 4 Point Likert Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard for the subjective scoring of how often something happens that ranges from 0: Not during the past month to 3: Three or more times a week.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Three or More Times a Week

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Three or More Times a Week
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that something occurs or occurred three or more times a week.

Concepts.longName: Three or More Times a Week
Concepts.definition: An indication that something occurs or occurred three or more times a week.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that something occurs or occurred once or twice a week.

Concepts.definition: An indication that something occurs or occurred once or twice a week.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that something occurs or occurred less than once a week.

Concepts.definition: An indication that something occurs or occurred less than once a week.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that something has not occurred during the past month.

Concepts.definition: An indication that something has not occurred during the past month.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring and Interpretation Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scoring and Interpretation materials are available on the University of Pittsburg, Sleep Medicine Institute website.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.
